verse: If I speak in the tongues of humans and of angels, but I do not have love, I have become a sounding brass [gong] or a clanging cymbal.
And if I have prophecy and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so as to remove mountains, but I do not have love, I am nothing.
And if I dole-out all my possessions, and if I hand-over my body so that I may boast, but I do not have love, I am profited nothing.
Love is patient. Love shows-kindness. Love does not envy, does not brag, is not puffed-up,
does not behave-dishonorably, does not seek its own things, is not provoked, does not count the bad,
does not rejoice over unrighteousness, but rejoices-with the truth,
bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

header: Love Is Permanent; Gifts Are Temporary. Be Pursuing Love

verse: Love never fails. But if there are prophecies, they will be set-aside. If there are tongues, they will cease. If there is knowledge, it will be set-aside.
For we know in part, and we prophesy in part—
but when the complete thing comes, the thing in part will be set-aside.
When I was a child, I was speaking like a child, thinking like a child, counting like a child— when I have become a man, I have set-aside the things of the child.
For now we are seeing through a mirror, in an enigma— but then face to face. Now I know in part— but then I will know-fully, just as I also was fully-known.
But now these three are remaining— faith, hope, love. But love is the greater of these.
